Synopsis:

Gus Lobel (Clint Eastwood) is a veteran baseball scout, those who refuse to work using the computer and bet all your chips on your feeling about players. With only three months to the end of his contract, he begins to have vision problems due to glaucoma. Hiding the disease of all, Gus is sent to examine Bo Gentry (Joe Massingill), a promising hitter who can be the choice of his team next draft. However, to suspect that something is wrong with his old friend, Pete Klein (John Goodman) asks his daughter, Mickey (Amy Adams), to accompany him on the trip. Mickey works as a lawyer and is about to become a partner in the company where he works, but bypasses the professional commitments to accompany his father, despite them having a troubled relationship. Together, they assess the potential of Gentry and find Johnny Flanagan (Justin Timberlake), a former baseball player who is now a scout for another team.
